intro: Luciliopsis argentina, commonly known as the Argentine luciliopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Its leaves are aromatic and finely divided, resembling those of other members of its family. While not widely cultivated, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
